pages.text:
Book a Private Event
Book an Event
The original owner of Snappers brought a slice of the Hamptons to the Keys when he moved from New York. His vision and passion have helped shape Snappers into the local favorite it is today. Under his original vision, Snappers has not only become a premier dining destination but also a preferred venue for all sorts of celebrations, weddings and special events.
One of the highlights of Snappers is the Turtle Club, where character and history blend seamlessly. The original bar stools were fashioned from old white captain's chairs, each with its own story to tell. The band's original stage, designed to resemble an old fishing cabin complete with its own dock, added a nostalgic touch, transporting guests back to simpler times.

Under his original vision, Snappers has not only become a premier dining destination but also a preferred venue for all sorts of celebrations, weddings and special events.
One of the highlights of Snappers is the Turtle Club, where character and history blend seamlessly. The original bar stools were fashioned from old white captain's chairs, each with its own story to tell. The band's original stage, designed to resemble an old fishing cabin complete with its own dock, added a nostalgic touch, transporting guests back to simpler times.

About Us
Snappers Key Largo
Established in 1989, Snappers stands as a vibrant testament to the rich heritage and enduring charm of Key Largo. However, the story of this beloved oceanside haven stretches back much further, with records showing that food, drinks, and good times have been served on these grounds since the 1960s. For over 40 years, Snappers has been a landmark restaurant and watering hole, earning its place as a cornerstone of the Florida Keys' dining and social scene.
Situated on 2.37 acres of prime uplands directly on the Atlantic Ocean, Snappers boasts a full license for 300 seats, ample parking, and bay bottom ownership. Our property includes 12 wet slips, providing ample boat dockage for seafaring guests, and the newly reconstructed Turtle Club, an extraordinary oceanfront venue unlike any other in the Florida Keys.
Make a Reservation
A Slice of The Hamptons
The original owner of Snappers brought a slice of the Hamptons to the Keys when he moved from New York. His vision and passion have helped shape Snappers into the local favorite it is today. Under his original vision, Snappers has not only become a premier dining destination but also a preferred venue for all sorts of celebrations, weddings and special events.
One of the highlights of Snappers is the Turtle Club, where character and history blend seamlessly. The original bar stools were fashioned from old white captain's chairs, each with its own story to tell. The band's original stage, designed to resemble an old fishing cabin complete with its own dock, added a nostalgic touch, transporting guests back to simpler times.
The Turtle Club
The classic Turtle Club took a beating during the last hurricane to the Florida Keys. RIP. But we're hard at work building a bigger and better one! And the spirit lives on – we have plenty of seats and plenty of drinks. Come by!
Become a Member
steeped in history and charm
The unique character of Snappers is enriched by the captivating history of its building, which has seen countless memorable moments even before the restaurant's official opening. The charming tales and rumors from the past add to the allure, making it a quintessential Florida beach bar with a story to tell.
Whether you're here for a delicious meal, a refreshing drink, or a memorable event, Snappers offers a unique experience steeped in history and charm. Join us and become a part of the Snappers legacy, where every visit is a celebration of the good times that have been a part of our story for decades.
Stay with Us
Get Here By Land
Address:
Mile Marker 94.5
139 Seaside Avenue
Key Largo, FL 33037
From North:
Follow the Florida Turnpike all the way down to the end and exit onto S. Dixie Hwy / US-1 South. Follow US-1 South for 33 miles. At Mile Marker 94.5, turn left at Lime St. Turn right at Seaside Ave.
From South:
Take US-1 North to Mile Marker 94.5 in Key Largo. Take a sharp right at Ocean View Blvd, and turn right at Seaside Ave.
Get Here By Sea
GPS:
N-25 02.424 / W-080.29.567
Snappers Marina:
Dock at one of our boat slips:
$3 per foot, per night
Great access for fishing and diving the patch reefs
Come by boat for lunch, brunch, dinner or cocktails
Call Us to Reserve a Slip:
Telephone: +1 (305) 305-0000
